case: A woman sues a coffee chain after suffering burns from spilled hot coffee.
summary: Serving excessively hot coffee without adequate warning constitutes negligence and breach of duty of care.

case: A school board enforces racial segregation in public schools.
summary: Racial segregation in public schools violates the Equal Protection Clause.

case: A newspaper publishes classified documents revealing government secrets.
citation: New York Times v. United States
summary: Prior restraint on press violates First Amendment rights unless national security is directly endangered.

case: A state bans same-sex marriage.
summary: Same-sex couples have a constitutional right to marry under due process and equal protection.

case: An employee is fired for union organizing activities.
citation: NLRB v. Jones & Laughlin Steel Corp.
summary: Workers are protected from retaliation for union activities under federal labor law.

case: A company enforces a contract with an unconscionable clause.
summary: Unconscionable contract terms are unenforceable as a matter of equity.

case: A factory dumps pollutants into a river causing harm to residents.
summary: Failure to regulate harmful emissions violates environmental protection obligations.

case: A tenant sues for unsafe living conditions due to lack of repairs.
citation: Javins v. First National Realty Corp.
summary: Landlords have a duty to maintain habitable premises under implied warranty of habitability.

case: A patient sues a doctor for negligence during surgery.
summary: Physicians must obtain informed consent and meet professional standards of care.

case: A woman is denied a job due to gender.
summary: Employment decisions based on gender stereotypes violate anti-discrimination laws.

case: A software company accuses a rival of copying source code.
summary: Fair use can protect reimplementation of APIs but not wholesale copying of code.

case: Police search a house without a warrant.
summary: Evidence obtained in violation of the Fourth Amendment is inadmissible in court.

case: A state bans teaching evolution in schools.
summary: Banning evolution teaching violates the Establishment Clause.

case: A landlord refuses to rent to a Black tenant.
citation: Jones v. Alfred H. Mayer Co.
summary: Private racial discrimination in housing sales or rentals is unlawful.

case: A state tries to regulate interstate shipping rates.
summary: Only Congress has authority to regulate interstate commerce.

case: A company requires employees to sign non-compete agreements.
citation: Addyston Pipe & Steel Co. v. United States
summary: Unreasonable restraints on trade and employment contracts violate antitrust laws.

case: A magazine publishes a false story harming a public figure.
summary: Public figures must prove actual malice to succeed in defamation claims.

case: A same-sex couple challenges state sodomy laws.
summary: Private, consensual sexual conduct is protected by constitutional liberty rights.

case: A state requires parental consent for abortion.
summary: States may regulate abortion but not impose undue burdens on access.

case: A company sells defective products causing injury.
summary: Manufacturers are strictly liable for defective products causing harm.

case: A president claims executive privilege to withhold evidence.
summary: Executive privilege cannot override judicial process in criminal investigations.

case: A state denies interracial couples the right to marry.
summary: Laws banning interracial marriage violate equal protection and due process.

case: A state requires children of undocumented immigrants to pay tuition.
summary: Denying free public education to undocumented children violates equal protection.

case: A company monopolizes a market and excludes competitors.
summary: Anti-competitive practices that maintain monopolies violate antitrust law.

case: A city bans handguns in private homes.
summary: Individuals have a constitutional right to possess firearms for self-defense.
